definition: (of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Mooney spoke about the reasons behind what he calls American inaction on climate change.
sentences.chinese: 莫涅談及了美國對氣候變化無動於衷的原因。

sentences.english: The problem is that most of the cells are still apathetic or disempowered.
sentences.chinese: 問題是大多數的細胞依然無動於衷。

sentences.english: He remained impervious to all nell's sulks and blandishments.
sentences.chinese: 對尼爾的慍怒和甜言蜜語，他都無動於衷。

sentences.english: By that time Haldon had vanished. Duck seemed unconcerned.
sentences.chinese: 那時候哈爾頓早就消失了，鴨子看起來也無動於衷。
“隨你的便好啦，”她無動於衷地回答說。

sentences.english: She is indifferent to your love for she shows no concern for you.
sentences.chinese: 她對你的愛情無動於衷，因爲她對你毫不關心。

sentences.english: Commentators were underwhelmed by Medvedev's attempts to shape the debate.
sentences.chinese: 評論員們對梅德韋傑夫想形成辯論的努力無動於衷。

sentences.english: Brother see him have a glimpse of indifferent after, straight regard my went up.
sentences.chinese: 兄見他瞟一眼後無動於衷，直顧自己走上去。
與此同時，谷歌仍然無動於衷。

sentences.english: How can you be indifferent to the sufferings of starving people?
sentences.chinese: 你怎能對饑民的疾苦無動於衷呢？

sentences.english: The fact that it's another person should make you care.
sentences.chinese: 你不應該對別人的痛苦無動於衷。

sentences.english: Regarding destroys the vehicle race which is on fire, we see indifferently actually.
sentences.chinese: 對於撞爛起火的賽車，我們見之卻無動於衷。

sentences.english: His indifference was a fuel to her hatred.
sentences.chinese: 他無動於衷使她心中的怨恨火上加油。
獠牙妖怪們對我們的遊戲無動於衷。

sentences.english: She received the news with apparent unconcern.
sentences.chinese: 她接到這消息時顯然無動於衷。

definition: to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to turn a blind eye to
to sound out/to probe/to feel out/to try out
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
to evade/to dodge (out of the way)
